intro: Phaeneilema dimorphum, commonly known as the two-form phaeneilema, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
